title: M5 shut in both directions for hours after body found on carriageway
text:

A large stretch of one of the UK's busiest motorways is closed this rush hour after a body was found.

Both sides of the M5 is shut between junction 11A for Brockworth and 12 for Quedgeley in Gloucestershire.

The 11-mile stretch will remain shut for some time.

Instead, drivers are advised to use the A417 and A38 to head south and the A38, A430 and A40 to travel north.

"Officers have closed the M5 between junctions 11A at Brockworth and junction 12 for Quedgeley after a person was found dead on the carriageway," a police spokesman said.

"The incident was reported shortly before 4.10am today (Wednesday 30 October).

"Officers attended the scene, on the southbound carriageway around a mile north of Gloucester Services, and have closed both sides of the motorway while the body is recovered and a serious investigation takes place."

Are you stuck in traffic? Contact webnews@trinitymirror.com

Pictures from live cameras show the deserted carriageway.

Stagecoach bus services have been diverted but alternative routes, including the A38, are also busy as a result.

The police spokesman added: "Diversions have been put in place but significant disruption is expected this morning and is likely to last for a number of hours while police continues its work at the scene and establish the circumstances.

"Anyone who may have information but hasn’t spoken to police should call 101 and quote incident 34 of 30 October."

The investigation continues.
description: The M5 is shut between junction 11A for Brockworth and 12 for Quedgeley in Gloucestershire as police recover the body
